name: SecureNet
description: Secure developer access to internal services without exposing your network
summary: A 'clean computer within an infected computer' - isolate developer access to internal services through zero trust networking and containers. Malware on the host cannot reach your network.

name: sovdev-logger
description: Multi-language structured logging with zero-effort observability - one log call, complete observability
summary: Stop writing separate code for logs, metrics, and traces. Write one log entry and automatically get structured logs, metrics dashboards, distributed traces, and service dependency maps.
body:

## The Solution

name: DocuWrite
description: Swiss army knife for converting Markdown to professional PDFs, Word documents, and presentations
summary: Generate professional documentation from Markdown files and Azure DevOps Wikis. Containerized toolbox combining Pandoc, Mermaid, and Marp for cross-platform document generation.
body:
## The Problem It Solves

Outdated documentation that stakeholders can't access. DocuWrite creates snapshot PDFs from your Wiki that everyone can share - same version, same meeting, delete after.

## Output Features

- Professional table of contents
- Numbered pages with generation timestamp
- Fully searchable PDF
- Auto-generated TODO list appendix
- Figures appendix
- Mermaid diagram support

## Included Tools

| Tool | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| Pandoc | Markdown to PDF, DOCX, and other formats |
| Mermaid CLI | Diagrams from text descriptions |
| Marp CLI | Slide decks (PDF, PowerPoint) from Markdown |
| Puppeteer | PDF from HTML |
| Firefox | PDF from HTML |

## Repositories

- **docuwrite-base** - Container with all tools (AMD64 + ARM64)
- **bifrost-docuwrite** - Wiki-to-PDF workflow automation

name: Bifrost
description: Application portfolio management - track all applications in your organization and their integrations
summary: System for keeping track of applications in an organization and all integrations between them. Visualize dependencies, automate documentation, and understand your IT landscape.
body:
## Features

- **Application Registry** - Catalog all applications in your organization
- **Integration Mapping** - Track connections and data flows between systems
- **Dependency Visualization** - Force-directed graphs showing relationships
- **Documentation Generation** - Auto-generate wiki and PDF catalogs
- **Import/Export** - Bulk import from Excel, ServiceNow integration

## Technical Stack

| Component | Technology |
|-----------|------------|
| Frontend | Next.js 14 (App Router) |
| Backend | Strapi CMS |
| API | TypeScript |
| Database | SQLite (dev) / PostgreSQL (prod) |
| Deployment | Kubernetes, Docker |

name: Urbalurba Infrastructure
description: A complete datacenter environment on your laptop - Kubernetes, databases, AI, and cloud services running locally
summary: Zero-friction developer platform for building, testing, and deploying modern apps without needing to know Kubernetes, GitOps, or the cloud. Same infrastructure locally, in cloud, and on-premises.
body:
## The Problem It Solves

- **'It works on my machine' syndrome** - Applications behave differently in development vs production
- **Complex cloud setup** - Developers waste time configuring cloud services
- **Permission bottlenecks** - Waiting for cloud access slows development
- **Expensive development** - Cloud costs accumulate during development
- **Data privacy concerns** - Sensitive data must leave your environment for cloud AI

## What's Included

| Category | Services |
|----------|----------|
| Core Infrastructure | Kubernetes cluster, Docker runtime, Provision Host |
| Data Services | PostgreSQL, Redis, message queues, object storage |
| AI & Machine Learning | Local ChatGPT-like system, private AI models, local LLM execution |
| Development Tools | GitOps workflows, dev containers, Infrastructure as Code |

## Key Benefits

- **Rapid Development** - Everything ready out of the box
- **True Portability** - Same environment everywhere
- **Data Privacy** - Nothing leaves your machine
- **Cost Effective** - No cloud charges during development
- **Production Confidence** - Test with real infrastructure locally

name: DevContainer Toolbox
description: Consistent development environments across Windows, Mac, and Linux using containers
summary: Eliminate 'it works on my machine' issues with a standardized, containerized development setup. Pre-configured with Azure CLI, Python, Node.js, and essential tools.
body:
## Features

- Pre-configured development environment using Debian 12 Bookworm
- Essential tools: Azure CLI, Python, Node.js, common CLI utilities
- VS Code extensions for Azure, PowerShell, Markdown, YAML
- Extensible architecture for role-specific tools
- Works with VS Code, JetBrains Rider, and Visual Studio

## Problems Solved

- Eliminates environment inconsistencies across team members
- Simplifies onboarding with ready-to-use setup
- Safe experimentation without affecting local machine
- Modular approach for adding development tools

## Template Library

Includes templates for web applications in C#, Python, Go, Java, PHP, TypeScript with frameworks like Next.js, React, Spring Boot, and Express.
